rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Was an astounding teacher. He was actively engaging and quite often had the class laughing or horribly embarrassed. He was personable when engaged one on one. Highly recommend taking him while at UNC.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Lectures well-organized but fairly dry. Instructor very nice; always willing to meet students halfway. Good at leading interesting class discussions.
No Comments

Lectures were fairly boring, though straight-forward.  If you read the book, going to class was probably not necessary-though I did.  Not a great experience, but not a bad one either for an introductory (and huge) class.

I had her for a first year seminar. She is a really nice lady; very set in her ways. I heard that she is a much better professor with the grad students one-on-one. Bland, course material not fun. She doesn't seem fit to teach a classroom full- only indiv.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Brilliant professor. This class had a very specific focus that made it very intellectually stimulating, but at times kind of alienating. The material can feel very dense at first, but with a little effort everything becomes pretty comprehensible. Plus, he hammers in his key points well. Make sure you go to class though!!

This professor seems very nice, and when he teaches the material you feel like you know it.  The problem occurs when he talks to you in private. He constantly condescends you, and acts as though you are the one making the mistakes, even if you are asking for helps.  I have never been talked to by a professor this way.  I would not recommend him.

he's really nice and wants you to learn the material. attendance isn't mandatory, but i recommend it since he basically tells you what he wants you to know. no book - just articles he posts on blkboard. added points to our midterm grade to encourage attendance, which is worth it even thought the class is at 8am. not terribly hard or easy either.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I loved this class! Dr. Lowman is nice, entertaining, & very enthusiastic about teaching. He was a little disorganized but his enthusiasm & humor made up for it. He assigned fun readings and class discussions were always interesting. Essay tests were challenging but if you keep up with the material and pay attention in class you should do fine.

I love Professor Lowman!  He's very intelligent and a great lecturer, and always has something interesting to say in class.  He doesn't always stick to his lecture outline, but if you read the textbook you'll be prepared for his tests.  He also gives you a lot of freedom with the term paper, which makes it pretty enjoyable. Best prof so far!

Stop complaining about essay tests, you're in college now, and multiple choice psyc exams are bs. There's a lot of reading but it's all really interesting so it was easy to do the work. Dude's really cool, even if he is a bit quirky! Even someone who has failed approx. 8-10 classes can do well in this class if you try. (DONE IT!)

This is a pretty terrible class taught by a rather disorganized professor. after I completed an assignment, told me that i had taken another class I would have done better (not preq.) Tests are subjective, will receive lower grades if he doesn't like your writing style. Awful.

Dr. Lowman is my favorite professor @ Carolina...he is hilarious and pretty much knows everything about any topic in the world. He is brilliant and his class lectures fly by because he is so engaging and entertaining. Assignments & tests: you have to work hard but As are possible.

The class was never boring but the assignments were very subjective and I didn't like that the tests were only essay questions.  Also is very "loose-brained"--doesn't ever really give a straight, clear answer to practical questions about assignments or other issues.

Tests are all essays. Weird if you're used to multiple choice psych tests, but not too difficult to do well if you go to class and at least skim the readings. Also a paper, analyzing a famous person in terms of personality theories. Absolutely great professor, nicest guy ever, very interesting but sort of quirky. Have lunch if you get the chance
Very interesting subject and lecturer. Tests were straightforward if you did the study guides.

Tests were challenging but you do very well if you put effort into studying.  Class was very interesting and laidback, he is a great professor.  I recommend him to anyone interested in a good psych course.
Good lecturer, hardly ever boring. Some assignments are tough, but interesting. Tests are straightforward, and let you argue your case.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. P is great. She is completely bonkers, but so kind and sweet. She really cares about her students and makes you want to do your best. The class itself was very interesting and didn't have too much work associated with it. I would highly recommend her!
Dr. Panter is awesome!  She really cares about her students and is really easy to talk to.  She super enthusiastic about stats.  I would definitely recommende her :)

Dr. Panter is the most caring professor I've ever had. She really cares about each individual student and always takes the time to ask you how you're doing. She is SUPER enthusiastic about statistics. She's kind of a perfectionist, but always has a positive attitude. I'm definitely going to keep in touch with her after this class!

Dr. Panter is a wonderful woman and professor. She is so sweet and is always concerned with how people are doing as individuals, not just their performance as students. She is not always clear and doesn't always answer e-mails but she is brilliant and more than willing to help you with anything you could ask for.
Amazing!!! She is THE Prof. to take. Any class that she is teaching....TAKE IT! You will not be disappointed.

Dr. Panter is absolutely wonderful. She's brilliant and cares so much about her students that it's insane. Every once in awhile you come across a professor that truly makes you WANT to learn and master the material and come to class! She is one of them and I adore her.
She is a very fun teacher who loves working with research and numbers.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I absolutely adore her. She's wickedly smart, loves her work, and is dedicated to making sure her students understand the "why" rather than the "what" of psychological research.
Really helpful professor and very nice person.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Very intelligent and an expert in psychological testing. Great lecturer and awesome professor. Be an interested and engaged student and you will enjoy his class very much. Keep up with the reading... the textbook was dry as can be, but the class was worth it.
Very cute!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Never worked so hard to get such bad grades in a psychology class

Powerpoint lectures are not available online. The TAs are really tough graders (and the only ones who actually grade your material). Dr. Hopfinger goes way too fast during lecture, and for some people, it's very difficult to meet with a professor after class to look at certain slides.

Dr. Hopfinger is a good lecturer, though at times he goes too fast for those who take notes by hand. All his powerpoints are online and he makes an effort to engage his students. We had five 2-page papers that were hell; few people got full points on them. A few voicethreads and discussion days for participation. B's are very common, A's are rare.
Good lecturer. Definitely there to help you. Fairly easy class. Several 1 page research review papers. A presentation. A midterm and a non-cumulative final. He's somewhat boring but a very nice guy.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Prof Curran is funny and eloquent. He's an academic that you can feel comfortable talking to outside of class. Lectures were a bit loose but the midterm and final were graded very fairly.
terrible class, lectures unclear and all he makes sure hes clear about is voicing his liberal opinions
Hot!

Great teacher who makes the subject interesting.  Provides class slides online, so going along with lectures are relatively easy.  Homework isn't terrible, and the tests are relatively easy so long as you've studied.
WONDEFUL! Makes stats understandable. Is always available and classes are as entertaining as they can be with grad stats. He's also a reallhy nice and funny person.
very nice man...exams and homework are pretty simple but study for his FINAL!!!
nice guy and I miss watching Wallace & Gromit!!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Loved this class! It is definitely an easy A. There are 5 short papers, 3 exams, and 1 final. You can drop the lowest grade for the papers and exams. Lectures are long but interesting. He likes to test people on the videos/examples/demonstrations, so take notes during those. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK. It is a huge waste of your money.

I didn't do quite as well as I thought I would in the class. The Psych 101 exams are all multiple choice, but he can be very detailed in lectures and on the exam, so the class is mostly a lot of fine memorization. Be prepared to understand minute differences in the material. I blame a tough TA for some bad essay grades. Overall a great class though

Dr. Penn has been my favorite professor at UNC so far. He is so passionate about what he teaches, and genuinely cares about each student's well being in the class. He notices when people are bored, and tries to entertain us with videos to make the material easier to learn. His tests aren't hard if you go to class. Loved this class.

Penn's class has been my favorite so far! He is funny and passionate. This class covers a lot of material so reading and taking notes in class is mandatory. He will have random questions on the test that deal with videos he shows in class and they usually have nothing to do with the material. Essays are graded by TAs, and some grade harder.

Great teacher! He was definitely the best professor I had this semester. It's fairly easy to do well as long as you go to class every day and make sure to study before the tests. He puts questions that come directly from what is covered in class.

Professor Penn's class is super easy. His lectures include every possible test question - so just show up and pay attention. You don't even have to read the textbook. Not to mention he drops the lowest test score. Plus, you have short essays that are super easy and interesting which he also drops the lowest score for. Lectures are interesting!

Dr. Penn and his class has been the HIGHLIGHT of my first semester at UNC. I did open the textbook once, attended every single lesson and still got an A in his class. His lectures are entertaining and covers all the information needed to ace the exams. Disappointed that he does not teach other courses for undergraduate students.

I loved Penn! He's a super fun guy and very quirky. You need to go to class, though, because he shows a lot of videos that he includes questions about on his exams and you don't have access to the videos unless you watch them in class!

Penn is the nicest man alive. His character is so warm and friendly. Penn's lectures are really interesting and he uses informative and funny videos throughout the lecture. He really tries to know your name when you participate. No homework! Grade: 3 exams and 5 essays lowest dropped for both. Go to class to pass. Lecture specific exam ?'s.

Dr. Penn is the man! PSYC 101 was by far the best class that I have had at UNC thus far. He is enthusiastic and hilarious during lectures. YOU MUST GO TO CLASS TO PASS. His tests are based purely on what happens in class and not really based on the textbook. As long as you take detailed notes you should be fine.

Dr. Penn is a great professor and will always help if you come to him. Lectures are sometimes a little boring, but he's excited about the subject, which makes them bearable. I would suggest showing up to every class because the info on the PowerPoints is generally just an outline of what he covers. He tells exactly what to expect on exams.

Penn is a great teacher! He is the reason I am a Psyc major. He really rewards students that go to class (if you go to class and study a little for the test, you'll get an A) and his study guides for his tests are very clear if you have been to class.

Penn is an awesome professor. I had never taken a psych class before his, and now I am in love. The tests are super simple. It's all memorization, and straight from the notes. If you come to class, you'll get a good grade.
Wonderful teacher! Very clear on what will be on test and is always willing to help!

Dr. Penn is the one of the better professors at UNC. Extremely nice guy, and very clear in what he expects from you. His tests aren't too difficult, but you need to attend class to do well. Overall a great experience and if you pay attention you will learn a lot.
He's so interactive in class! He doesn't rush through lectures and gives time you time to write down the notes!
Super nice guy, great teacher. Psych is not that interesting but he does his best to change that. Funny videos in class. Necessary to go to class, most of tests are  based on lectures

I can't say enough good things. He genuinely cares about making the lecture interesting and adds funny bitsvideos. He makes an effort to learn each person's name, even though the class is over 200 people, making the class feel much more intimate. His tests are completely fair, though attending is worth your time for some of the questions!

Straightforward class, several opportunities for extra credit. If you go to most classes and put in some effort doing all the readings you will do fine! Very helpful if you have questions, tries to use videos and other interesting examples in class to keep you interested. Just took for GenEds but made me want to take more PSYC classes in the future

Took Dr. Penn's Psych 101 class. He specifically tell you "this is going to be on the exam" and even gives you a study guide before each exam.   Also, he incorporates some humor into his lectures, which is a good change from other professors. Very personable with students. He tries to memorize each student's name in a class of 250. Impressive.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Mulligan makes the material much more interesting by giving us experiments corresponding to the cogntive concepts discussed in the textbook. The tests focus A LOT more on what we covered in class and knowing textbook concepts is definitely secondary. Overall he's a very nice, clear, and helpful prof but at 8am the lectures can get boring.
Definitely knowledgeable and willing to help. Lectures can be boring (especially at 8 am) but he can be humorous.

Pretty knowledgeable professor and generally a nice guy. I suggest taking notes on your computer because he can talk pretty fast. Also, avoid this class if it's after lunch, because it's easy to fall asleep and get bored. Study hard for the tests, they can be a bit challenging. Overall, an okay professor.

He really knows what he is talking about, and is really helpful in answering questions. The class is very interesting - *IF* you're into psychology and models of cognition/memory, and he can be hilariously witty at the most random times. Tests are multiple choice/essay, and not too difficult, but you've got to go to class.
Great teacher but lectures were really boring.

I had Prof. Mulligan for Cognative Psyc. and Human memory.  I thoroughly enjoyed both classes.  He explains the material extremely well and he is very willing to help his students.  You can tell he is interested in the material he teaches.  It is important to attend all his lectures.  I would recomend his classes to anyone interested in psychology.
Unless i just dont like the material this class was pretty dull, but he seemed nice
He's a nice guy but exam & paper grading is far too arbitrary. Depended exclusively on essay questions and was incredibly subjective in grading.
Really nice guy. Explains things thouroughly.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Arnold's PSYC 58 seminar is quite easy. A nice teacher but could be a boringbad lecturer.
She was a good teacher. I had her for a FYS. It was my highest grade, and my easiest class my first semester of my first year. Great teacher! Nice lady! Cool class! Thumbs up.

I loved this class! Her lectures were usually engaging, and I thought she did a good job of explaining the sometimes confusing concepts. Lots of tests = each test covered less material, each test not worth as much = better grades. Challenging yet interesting class - one of my favorites so far at UNC.
multiple choice part of test not as difficult as essay.  Tends to run out of time.  Will help you if you approach her.  Textbook v. boring

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Best, easiest, kindest professor I have had in my 4 years. She is so funny and nice, and understands that Maymester is hard enough, so she grades very easily for those who participate.

clinical psych. tests can be tricky, and not many questions, so missing a few is bad. lots of free points from presentations/participation. not thrilled to be teaching, but really good when she answers student questions.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Mitch is passionate about his work and wants to help all students succeed.  Midterm and final is graded fairly as long as you can demonstrate that you understand the material taught.  Always willing to meet and talk about the class/paper/etc.  Would recommend his classes!
Amazing. Mitch is fun, friendly, and brilliant. This class is pretty easy. Try to get into his lab if you want research experience. He's an incredible mentor.
Easy class. Got boring sometimes, but he kept it pretty interesting. Very engaging lecturer. I would recommend him for this class

Prinstein was great. I think stat is really, really boring, but he actually made it interesting. The tests and assignments were not hard at all, and he's a funny guy who really cares about his students. Fantastic professor, fantastic class.

Funny guy who keeps a potentially boring class interesting. The class is pretty easy if you've had any stats before. Lab is useless, but tolerable. He is really interested in teaching and knows a lot about the subject, seems very willing to help out students; he's on your side (if that makes any sense).

Having only had him for independent study work, I must say that he is a nice professor, but is quite disorganized.  Make sure you spell out exactly what your questions are, and be certain that there is a clear agreement in what is expected.
Has a real interest in the subject.  Very engaging teacher which could make any class fun to be in.
Funniest teacher ever! Made a really crappy class fun (or at least not torture... I hate math)

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Amazing prof, really made the material interesting. I ended up nominating him for a teaching award because of this class.
very nice, helpful, and great to look at

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: If you enjoy psychology at all, take any class you can with him! He definitely enjoys the material as well as wants to helps his students succeed. One of the best professors I've had at UNC.
Great professor! Highly recommended for any psyc majors. Especially individuals considering graduate school
HE IS THE BEST!!!!!!!!!!!

This class was horribly boring.  He tries to make it amusing but I constantly had to fight off sleep.  Nice guy though.  Approachable and always looking to help.  But if you prefer a structured environment, look elsewhere.

Dr. Youngstrom was a great professor. I'm innately horrible at math, and with his help (his TA Andrew Freedman is really good too) I got an A in statistics! Always willing to help, and he obviously designs the class so you can get the highest grade possible. If you have to take PSYC 210, definitely take it with Youngstrom!

I took this class in summer session. It went fast. The professor tried to make stats interesting, did the best he could with the material. The TA does all the grading and was extremely strict. I disagree with the other student, when the TA made an error grading, he fixed it. The TA was extremely fair.
This dude is goofy as hell.  He does his best to makes statistics interesting.  Take his class if you get the chance.  You'll actually learn the material without being bored to tears.

He did a great job of making this a good class.  The class itself is incredibly easy/boring, but he did an awesome job of giving engaging lectures.  He's a really nice guy.  I would definitely recommend him as a professor.
Best Prof Ever! Makes Stats fun and very good at explaining. Recitations are not mandatory, but can be helpful. I totally recommend this class if you have to take psyc 210.

Wonderful guy!!! He made stats painless, which was great since none of us wanted to be there. He also gave us a spreadsheet before the final that told us exactly what each of us needed on the final to get the next highest grade and the next highest etc up to an A, but I think there was a curve at the end too, which explains my solid A.

Dr. Youngstrom is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. He managed to make something as boring as statistics extremely fun! I would recommend this class to anyone who is a psychology major or who needs a statistics class!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Sara is really upbeat and does lots of demos in class.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Gray is the best. He lectures every class but he actually is really engaging with his talks, I was never bored.  He is incredibly helpful and answers questions well. It was one of the best classes I've taken at Carolina and it was definitely because of Dr. Gray. His tests do have questions that you'd only know if you regularly came to class.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Neblett is the best professor I have had at UNC.  He strongly encourages student engagement and participation, and he respects your opinion.  I learned things in this class about myself I never expected to learn.  I feel like it made me a better person.  It's such a great class, and Professor Neblett is such a great guy! (same as PSYC89)

A great professor! His course made you think, and he encouraged class discussion (participation grade depended on it). A couple fun and interesting group projects, and no tests. It was easy to make friends and grasp the material in this class. Mostly readings, journals, and brief papers for HW. Perfect for first-years (hence, First-year seminar).

Dr. Neblett is very nice and he knows the subject matter well. He also lets the students talk more than he does so participate if you want your class to be interesting. We had no test or quizzes but half of your grade is group work but he's a pretty easier grader. Sticking to the assignments along with incorporating creativity is rewarded. Easy A

Loved his class! He gives great feedback, leads amazing class discussions, and inspires you to make change! Classwork wasn't tough at all. 2 page essays and journals. Recommend you to take a class with him, great guy!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She is awesome! Made the 8am class worth going to-very engaging. Loved the class and it was straightforward.

This class is very interesting and easy to get an A! There are a few group projects that will take up some time. There is quite a bit of reading involved, but because I was interested in the material it was bearable. She is always there to help and is SO understanding. I liked this class so much that I decided to take another with her (PSYC 245)!

She is a great teacher with high enthusiasm in the subject material. She posts lecture outlines and then neatly follows them in class. The subject isn't very difficult but the test can be tricky if you don't study the terms. Otherwise no homework and one paper.
